user_question: How do mirror neurons contribute to empathy, and can you generate an image of neurons in action?
final_answer: Mirror neurons are a type of brain cell that respond equally when we perform an action and when we witness someone else perform the same action. They are thought to play a role in understanding others' actions and intentions, thus contributing to empathy. Image of neurons in action generated.
